item.title: Drain blocked to road floods when it rains, 12th February
item.description:
The drain is on Clarence Road and left hand side of street. It is the last drain before the Pittville gates in the flow of one way traffic. This has been reported before but it evident nothing has been done. It seems the drain after the Pittville gates were looked at but wasn't an issue.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Clarence Road, Marle Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Street light failure and many traffic bollards vandalised and not illuminated, 12th February
item.description:
The street light at the roundabout with Sunrise Avenue and Evesham Road is not working. This is the one facing Sunrise Avenue Also many of the light traffic bollards have failed, and have been vandalised..
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Evesham Road, Bishop's Cleeve
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Persistant flooding for nearly 3 weeks, 12th February
item.description:
Approaching traffic lights to Gloucester airport. This is an ongoing problem and the road has been flooded for nearly 3 weeks. On numerous occasions I have met oncoming vehicles coming round the bend at speed in the middle of the road to avoid flood water. This is DANGEROUS and is an accident waiting to happen . Please clear the drains !!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Old Gloucester Road, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Street light is permanently out problem, 12th February
item.description:
Caller reports that street lighting has been out for over a week.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large round hole in footpath which seems to be an active rat burrow, 12th February
item.description:
Public footpath Bucklehaven and Stockton Close — large rat hole and signs of rats burrowing. Hole likely a hazard to walkers and may be attracting pests. I am worried about it getting bigger, more appearing.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 7, Stockton Close, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fallen tree branch, 12th February
item.description:
The tree outside 47a Brooklyn road, Cheltenham gl51 8DT has a big fallen branch, which happened 11/2/2026. It had fallen away from the tree around 4-5pm, it had fallen over the path, and has been moved to the roadside. The tree needs to be looked at and make sure it’s safe, as this could have been more of a problem, if it had fallen on a car or passing people. This needs sorting sooner rather than later, for health and safety reasons, many thanks.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 59, Brooklyn Road, Wymans Brook, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Update on 8703911 further deterioration, 12th February
item.description:
This was reported under 8703911 but was deemed to not require fixing. I don’t understand the criteria or rationale for this as the hole is deeper than the golf ball (which you can see from the photos first floats then sinks out of sight) and you have marked up for repair a different pot hole within 20m of this one. It doesn’t seem a sensible use of taxpayers money to have to repeatedly return to the same area instead of fixing all the adjacent pot holes at the same time.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Dog Lane, Badgeworth, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 8 inches across, 12th February
item.description:
There is a cluster of potholes outside number 14 Mead Road. They have been filled one at a time over the last 3 months. We have heavy traffic due to Travis and the closure of London Road and being a cut through. What is so frustrating is seeing one right next to a repair and having to keep coming back. Thank you

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 12, Mead Road, Naunton, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
